title: Metacognitive Strategy Application in Mathematics Education: Explicit and Internalization Training Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical concepts (operations, problem-solving) and self-reflection experience
context.additional_context: Non-face-to-face education optimized for smartphone-based learning environments

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish and explain three or more metacognitive strategies (planning-monitoring-evaluation) in mathematical problem-solving.
Learners can demonstrate problem-solving processes using explicit metacognitive questions (e.g., "Why?" or "Alternative methods?") for given math problems.
Learners can systematically review their thinking processes by maintaining a weekly math learning journal for one week.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
